Entries.default:
The captain of the Tidebreaker stands stiff-backed before you, looming despite her lack of height. 

Her hard-muscled legs spread solidly apart, and she splays thick, calloused hands over her hips. She regards you with a heavy gaze, her chin tipped high.
"Way I see it, you've got two options. You can tell me who sent you. Or I can feed you the shaft of my gun."
"Dereo sends his regards."
[Show her the suolenet.]
"That all the scupperlout sends? Tell me, what does he need for now?"
"And though it pains me to say it, if the Mataru are biting for blood, it's best if I back off. I can't be feeding the Roparu right under their noses."
"How did you get your hands on a suolenet? Lie to me and I'll blast you where you stand."
"A corpse was wearing it in the Old City. He'd been executed by the Gullet's guards."

"Rot the damn Mataru. At least it wasn't one of mine. This time."

She shakes her head, dropping the coin back to your hand.
"What can I do to ensure your operation continues - safely in secret - to see the Roparu properly fed?"
"Leave the secrecy to me. What you need to prove is that you can be trusted. Well enough." She winks.
"Best make room for a shipment of luminous adra, then."
"Now if that doesn't tickle your fancy, there is one other that tickles mine. Ply me with enough coin to hire fresh hands, bribe a few officials, enjoy a taste of flesh, and I'm yours."
"How much coin are we talking about?"
[Leave] "I'll come back when I've got the coin."
[Leave] "I'll be on my way."
"Thirty thousand copper ought to cover it."
"Put the risk on the Dawnstars. They're willing to supply crops as long as the shipments can be smuggled through the Undercroft."
"Nonetheless, I'll still be needing some assurance that it'll be worth my while."
"Ah, I guess..." She ticks the various expenses on her fingers.
The captain smiles wickedly, a mad cast darkening her features.
"Deal."
"Deal."
"We'll catch us a fresh contact, round up the shipments again soon. Strong and sure."
The captain massage the hefty sack of coin with her meaty hands. Her head bobs, weaving to a mad music only she can hear.
"I'm here to conduct some business with one of Dereo's contacts, Gwenfin."
"Guess I heard as much from a crewhand. You're free to go about, then. But I'd ask that you keep your nose out of our affairs, else we need to slit it off."
"Well? Regale me."
"Remind me again how much it'd cost for the Príncipi to keep smuggling food to the Roparu."
"Will you continue smuggling food to the Roparu?"
"Everyone in the Gullet knows Ulög's my man. Everyone 'cept the Mataru. Got to be them what got him." She hocks a great gob of spit on the ground beneath her feet.
"And after that?"
"Never mind for now."
"He shattered both legs - was Hylea's mercy that he broke nothing more. But after that he lost his taste for the sea."
"It's a mistake sailors make only once."
"No one sent me. You just have piss-poor security."

"Blunt, I like that. It's too bad then that I've got to kill you."

She grins, a mad glint in her eye. Then, with a whistle to her crew, she frees her flintlock and descends upon you.
The captain's eyes narrow into knives, but after a span of several heartbeats, she merely sniffs and blinks away.
"Know what makes you a pirate, lovesome?"

"And who - or what - do we have here?"

Stubby fingers grind impatiently toward the flintlock tucked into her belt.

Morena's features are harsh, cutting. Her hair is drawn up into a large braid on the top of her head. Feathers and bits of bone - teeth and phalanges wrapped with ribbon - jut from tresses that gleam like red wine in the low light.

You don't doubt she'd follow through on her threat - or try to.
"Does it really matter?"
"Less'n you killed one of my crew - and seeing as that isn't one of mine, so I doubt it - then no."
The captain strokes the powder horn strapped to her thigh. She exhales a ragged breath.

"And you had nothing to do with it? Then I need to know how it happened."

Her eyes gleam with a promise of violence.
"I don't know."
[Lie] "I don't know."

"Ulög wasn't any ruffler. He didn't deserve that."

She runs her tongue over her teeth, regaining a measure of calm.
"Looked like he'd been beaten to death."
"Guess that's the way of it, sometimes. But it's not what I would've hoped for." She sighs.
"Ulög's been killed, meaning the Roparu will starve without the food he smuggled into the Gullet."
"There's something you need to know."
"You've got my ear. So spit it out, swabby."
[Leave] "Never mind."
Her expression twists, face purpling with blood.
"We can go around the Mataru."
She shrugs one stocky shoulder.
"And I've merely to trust you, says you? No, I'll be needing a little more leverage than that."
"The Dawnstars are eager to help the downtrodden. Why not work with them?"
"Loot me no less'n four crates, and I'll be, let's say, 'better inclined' to do you a favor."
"Twenty thousand copper ought to cover it."
"No. But I'll get you the luminous adra."
"Always a pleasure, pirating is. I'll keep an eye on the horizon for your prosperous return."
"Tell them goodlies at the Temple of Gaun to keep an eye out for a gentleman of fortune, come to worship soon. It'll be my first mate, looking to cast up the details."
The captain massage the hefty sack of coin with her meaty hands. Her head bobs, weaving to a mad music only she can hear.
[Retreat, hands up.] "Took a wrong turn. That's all."
"Oh, this is rich. You've conned the goodly missionaries into sullying their souls like real freebooters."
"Ah, right. I might swear you've proved your capability good enough to me."
"Bide where you are, lovesome."
"Loot me no less'n four crates, and I'll be, let's say, 'better inclined' to do you a favor."

"Not so fast, swabby. If I'm to let you walk, it'll be cause you've done me something good. Something like..."

She thumbs the polished butt of the pistol thoughtfully.
[Attack] "No deal, pirate."

"Oh, and swabby. If you're thinking to cross me on this... Next I see you, I'll skin you from the neck, then roast you alive." 

Then she dips her head to you in a genteel farewell.
She grins agreeably, teeth small and crooked in her mouth.
She dips her chin in a gruff nod farewell.
[Lie] "Dereo gave it to me."
She inspects the imprinted coin a little more closely, eyes half-mast, but finally she nods and grunts her acceptance.
"So you're one of us. Now, why're you here?"
Shocked, she snatches for the leather-strung coin, rubbing it between her fingers.
In a heartbeat, the grin disappears from her face.

"You just may be my new favorite sea wolf."

She runs her tongue over her teeth, eyes roving your face.
"Hello, swabby."

"Watcher. Finest bit of fire and fury I've ever seen. Finest bit of flesh, too."

She winks, raising her chin in greeting.
"Come, we'll drink to a better friendship. Pay no mind to the tang of the flavor."
"Got any work I could take on?"
She eyes you for a moment before answering.
"I've got the luminous adra."
"Ah, what lovelies. Aye, fine work you've done. Work I won't be likely to forget."
"You know Dereo?"
"Of course. He's my landlubberly contact in the Gullet."
[Punch her in the mouth.]

Unexpectedly, you rear back and sucker-punch the captain in the mouth. The stocky pirate staggers before regaining herself, a hand resting on the butt of her flintlock as she spits blood on the ground.

She cuts you a glare.
Then abruptly she throws her head back and laughs.
"No, I've earned my standing with the Príncipi. I want you to do this, no strings attached, 'cause I'm the one asking."
The dwarf sucks on her teeth, head wavering side to side as she debates your point.
"A right fair argument if I ever heard one. You sail with us - you die with us. Makes you ours. And we care for our treasures."
"What in Ondra's tit was that for?!"
"I don't like being threatened."
[Shrug.]
"I'll be real sure to remember that."
"Gods, you're madder than me."
"Once he was a master sailmaker. Lot of Príncipi crews vied for him, but he lost his footing in the rigging one day."
"I'll ask you again to make it worth my while, if you be wanting my interest that is."
"And though it pains me to say it, if the Mataru are biting for blood, it's best if I back off. I can't be feeding the Roparu right under their noses."
"Aye, guess I do."
"I invite you to hand it over swiftly then." The captain's expression brightens, lit with her greed.
"A deal's a deal, then."
"A blackened heart and insatiable lust for plunder?"
[Shake your head.]
"I'll bet you're going to tell me."
She grins. "Sailing. It's sailing what makes you a right pirate. Sure, plundering, too. But leave the seas, and you leave the Príncipi."
"If you're a particularly daring sort, you might snatch it from under their noses."
"Loot me no less'n three crates, and I'll be, let's say, 'better inclined' to do you a favor."
"Loot me no less'n six crates, and I'll be, let's say, 'better inclined' to do you a favor."
"Loot me no less'n six crates, and I'll be, let's say, 'better inclined' to do you a favor."
"Loot me no less'n three crates, and I'll be, let's say, 'better inclined' to do you a favor."
"Moving so much adra risks notice from others. Perhaps a smaller delivery would be shrewder... to protect your operations."
"Perhaps just four crates might better suffice."
"Moving so much adra risks notice from others. Perhaps a smaller delivery would be shrewder... to protect your operations."
"Perhaps just four crates might better suffice."
"Perhaps just three crates might better suffice."
"If you're a particularly daring sort, you might snatch it from under their noses."
"We're all stocked up on silverfin, but this fish is a unique catch..."
"And I can bite deeper than you might imagine." He narrows his eyes at her.
"Are you the one responsible for tricking the watershapers into serving your petty errands?"
Something about the aggression in his tone causes her mouth to split in a crooked grin. Mad Morena turns her gaze back to you.
"Perhaps Furrante would disagree with you."
"I see."
"Aye, but Aeldys wouldn't. And she's the only other captain what matters to me."
"You don't see me flying Furrante's flag, now do you? My loyalty lies with the new blood - the future and the strength of the Príncipi."
"I hope you do, lovesome."
"Continue? Nay. Consider, aye."
"Aye. Wouldn't want to be reckless, now would we?"
"Aye. Wouldn't want to be reckless, now would we?"
"Say I happen to have a fella wanting for a full shipment of crude luminous adra. But I have no adra to sell."
"Say I happen to have a fella wanting for a full shipment of crude luminous adra. But I have no adra to sell."
"Say I happen to have a fella wanting for a full shipment of crude luminous adra. But I have no adra to sell."
"Otherwise, you could raid them in shallow waters as they ship it in."
"Otherwise, you could raid them in shallow waters as they ship it in."
She grins madly, tiny teeth tinged red as she swipes a thumb at the corner of her mouth.
"Everyone in the Gullet knows Ulög's my man. Everyone 'cept the Mataru. Got to be them what got him." She hocks a great gob of spit on the ground beneath her feet.
"Unless you can make it worth my while, that is."
"I've come to assist you as a favor to Captain Aeldys."

"She always has the most lovely - and interesting - sorts vying for her attention.

"Suppose me and you ain't so different in that regard." Mad Morena grins wolfishly, all teeth.

"The commander of my fleet - and the relentless leader of us new bloods, Captain Aeldys - won't forget either. If you're feeling adventurous, you might call on her at Fort Deadlight."

The dwarf laughs bawdily as if to an inside joke.
"Not so fast, swabby. Think you can come scurrying into my port without paying me a favor?" She tuts you, shaking her head.

"So hop to it, swabby. You know what it is I need."

The captain spreads her arms wide, expectant.
"You know what I want. Get me the luminous adra or pay up if you wish to buy my cooperation."
"See to your business. But stay out of ours." She nods gruffly to signal that you're free to go.
"Your man Ulög's dead. I found his body."
She lifts a hand to finger a black feather plaited in her hair. But just as quickly it drops back, close to her belted firearm.
"You say Ulög's got himself murdered? You see the body?"
"I found him in the Narrows with his limbs pointing every which way."
[Shrug.]
[Shrug.]
"He'd been saying there were some big types what'd been following him around, but I told him to put a sock in it."
"Looks like the kid was right."
"Enoi told me to find you."
"I heard there was business being done down here and thought I'd bring a donation."
"What for? I've already got an emissary. Speak up, swabby, and be quick about it. My knife-arm's twitchin'."
"Somebody killed your man Ulög, and the Roparu still need food."
"Well, aren't you thoughtful. Now tell me what you want."
"No, but Enoi's sure he's dead."
"Old man's got eyes everywhere such that he doesn't need any of his own. If he says something's happened, it probably did."
"So Enoi fancies you the new Ulög, eh?"
"I'm of a mind to hang you naked over a pool of sharks, but I might have a use for an... enterprising person like yourself."
"Them Vailian-Trading princocks have a stockpile of it in their mill in Queen's Berth."

"Aye, you best turn tail and retread your steps, swabby. And be quick about it, lest you catch a knife in the back."

The dwarf narrows her eyes, hand resting on the butt of her pistol, then dismisses you with a grunt.
"The Roparu will have to stand on their own two feet some day, but for now, we'll keep 'em out of the ground."
"The Roparu will have to stand on their own two feet some day, but for now, we'll keep 'em out of the ground."
"I'm here to find business opportunities."
"We've got a wide open sea ahead of us, Watcher. Thanks to you."
"You're loyal through and through. Any time you need the support, you let me know, captain."
"The Seawolf rules the Council now. As it should be."
"Battle and blood! My two most favorite things - after booze and gold, that is."
"I'll think about it."
"Them Vailian-Trading princocks have a stockpile of it in their mill in Queen's Berth."
"Otherwise, you could raid them in shallow waters as they ship it in."
"Them Vailian-Trading princocks have a stockpile of it in their mill in Queen's Berth."
"Otherwise, you could raid them in shallow waters as they ship it in."
"See to your business. But stay out of ours." She nods gruffly to signal that you're free to go.
"Picking a fight with my crew ain't the smartest means for getting my attention. But here we are - and with blood between us."
She drums her fingers on the flintlock as she considers Tekēhu.
"Our type, we draw blades and barkers first. Ask questions after. So I'll forgive your hot-bloodedness this time. "But see that you don't get into it with my crew again."
"Now, for our business arrangement..."
"And neither will Captain Aeldys. Best believe I'll be sending her a missive to sing of your praises."
